project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Central Transport Corridor Project (CTCP) is to: (a) upgrade strategic road links; (b) enhance road management capacity; and, (c) improve operations of Tanzanian Railways (TRC and TAZARA).To this end, through its components the project will: 1) upgrade strategic road links, which  includes the rehabilitation of 3 different road sections on Zanzibar's sea shore, in addition to the Singida-Shelui Road (110 km) leading from the region's headquarters, to the border of the Tabora region, and, the roads starting at Mkwajuni along the coastal valley to Nungwi; Matemwe-Pongwe road; Paje-Pingwe road; all three areas of strategic tourism importance. In addition, the rehabilitation of 5 key ferries is being proposed, subject to study recommendations, as well as proposals on the option of concessioning to private operators.  The component will also finance feasibility studies and detailed engineering designs regarding road upgrading; 2) support TANROADS build its headquarters in Dar es Salaam, and, will fund civil works and supervision. It will assist TANROADS carry out a job evaluation, determine the level of staffing and identify areas that require strengthening. It will also help them identify skills not available within the organization that would need to be out-sourced in the short and medium term while the organizations makes alternative long term plans. Transport studies financed by the component include Dar es Salaam Rapid Bus Transit and Traffic Management Study, and  several studies in the transport sector to cover not only roads, but ports and other related aspects. Training and technical assistance will be provided; 3) Improve infrastructure of the Tanzania Railway Corporation, proposing a concession that will include a 25-year lease for the TRC railway network, with the right to manage, and maintain the network, and lease of TRC locom
